It ensures secure access by allowing only the authenticated owner of the study task to fetch memo details. The returned object contains the memo text along with creation and update timestamps for client display or editing purposes.
operations.description:
Retrieve a single memo note identified by 'memoId' that belongs to the specified study task for the authenticated student user.

This operation queries the 'study_planner_memos' table to fetch the particular memo entity linked to the study task.

Security ensures that only the task owner can access the memo details.

The response contains memo text, creation date, and last update date.

Errors may be returned if the memo or study task does not exist or the user lacks authorization.
operations.summary: Retrieve details of a specific memo attached to a study task

parameters.name: studyTaskId
parameters.description: UUID of the target study task

parameters.name: memoId
parameters.description: UUID of the memo to retrieve

operations.name: atMemo

operations.specification: This operation creates a new memo note for a specific study task in the StudyPlanner system. It interacts with the 'study_planner_memos' table holding textual memos linked to study tasks. The operation requires the ID of the study task to associate the new memo and a request body containing the memo text. It enforces security by allowing only the authenticated owner of the study task to add memos. Upon successful creation, the new memo object including creation and update timestamps is returned for client usage.
operations.description:
Create a new memo note associated with the specified study task owned by the authenticated student user.

This operation adds a record to the 'study_planner_memos' table linking text notes to the study task to support user note-taking.

Authentication and authorization ensure only the owner can create memos for their task.

The request body must contain the memo text content.

The response returns the created memo object with its timestamps.

Errors include validation failures if memo text is invalid or missing.

This operation helps users enrich their study tasks with additional textual information.
operations.summary: Create a memo note linked to a study task

parameters.name: studyTaskId
parameters.description: UUID of the target study task

requestBody.description: Memo creation data

operations.name: createMemo

operations.specification: This operation updates a specific memo associated with a particular study task in the StudyPlanner backend database. It modifies the memo text content and updates timestamps accordingly. It operates on the 'study_planner_memos' table in the database schema. The operation requires the IDs of the parent study task and the memo to identify the target memo record precisely. It checks that the memo belongs to the specified study task. Typical validation includes verifying memo_text length and ownership. Because memo management is user-critical, authentication is required. No request body returns are expected other than the updated memo.
operations.description:
This API operation allows an authenticated student user to update the content of an existing memo linked to one of their study tasks.

The memo is uniquely identified by both the study task ID and memo ID provided in the request path parameters.

Security considerations require that only the owning student can update the memo associated with their study task.

The operation updates the 'memo_text' field and the 'updated_at' timestamp in the 'study_planner_memos' database table.

Validation includes ensuring the memo_text is a non-empty string that meets length constraints.

Errors include 401 Unauthorized if the user is not authenticated or not owner, 404 Not Found if memo or study task do not exist, and 400 Bad Request if validation fails.

Successful response returns the updated memo entity as detailed in the response body.
operations.summary: Update a memo entry of a study task in the StudyPlanner database

parameters.name: studyTaskId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the parent study task

parameters.name: memoId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the memo to update

requestBody.description: Memo update payload containing new memo text

operations.name: updateMemo

operations.specification: This operation deletes a specific memo associated with a study task in the StudyPlanner system. It removes the memo entirely from the 'study_planner_memos' table based on the memo ID and parent study task ID. This is a hard delete operation as the schema does not have soft delete for memos. Access is restricted to authenticated student users owning the study task. No request body is needed. Successful deletion returns no content.
operations.description:
This API endpoint enables authenticated student users to completely remove a memo attached to their study task.

The memo to delete is specified via the memo ID and the parent study task ID path parameters ensuring exact identification.

Security checks ensure only the owner can delete their memo.

Being a hard delete, the memo record is removed fully from the database.

If the memo or task does not exist or does not belong to the user, appropriate errors are returned.

Successful response is empty with HTTP 204 No Content status.

This operation is part of the resource management workflow enabling users to clean up their study task notes.
operations.summary: Delete a memo entry from a study task in the StudyPlanner database

parameters.name: studyTaskId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the parent study task

parameters.name: memoId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the memo to delete

operations.name: eraseMemo

operations.specification: This operation retrieves a paginated and filtered list of task alarms set by authenticated student users in the StudyPlanner backend. These alarms are linked to study tasks and trigger notifications at scheduled times. The result supports searching by student id, task id, alarm time, and pagination/sorting. It operates on the 'study_planner_task_alarms' table. Authorization is required to view a user's own alarms. The operation returns a paginated list of alarms with summary data.
operations.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of task alarms associated with study tasks for the authenticated student.

This search API supports filtering by various criteria such as alarm title, time range, and associated study task.

Security restrictions ensure a user can only view their own alarms.

The response contains a paginated list of alarm summaries including alarm ID, title, alarm time, and associated task ID.

Errors include 401 Unauthorized for unauthenticated access.

This operation supports management of alarms set for study reminders within the StudyPlanner system.
operations.summary: Search and retrieve a paginated list of task alarms

requestBody.description: Filtering and pagination parameters for task alarms

responseBody.description: Paginated list of task alarm summaries

operations.name: searchTaskAlarms

The alarm is identified by its unique ID. It returns full alarm details including associated study task and scheduling information. Security ensures only the owner can retrieve this alarm. The operation operates on the 'study_planner_task_alarms' table in the Prisma schema.
operations.description:
Get detailed information about a single task alarm associated with the authenticated user's study tasks.

This operation requires the path parameter to specify the exact alarm ID.

Security checks ensure only the owner student can access their task alarm.

Successful requests return the complete task alarm record including timestamps, title, alarm time, and associated study task.

Errors include 401 Unauthorized if not logged in, 404 Not Found if alarm does not exist or does not belong to the user.

This operation supports alarm management features in the StudyPlanner system.

parameters.name: taskAlarmId

operations.specification: This operation creates a new study task alarm for an authenticated student user, associating the alarm with a specific study task. It stores alarm details such as title and scheduled alarm time. This operation allows students to set reminders for their study tasks to receive PWA notifications at designated times. The underlying database table is study_planner_task_alarms, which manages user-specific alarms linked to study tasks. Validation ensures the student owns the task and that alarm_time is a valid future timestamp. Duplicate alarms with identical student_id, study_task_id, and alarm_time are prevented by a uniqueness constraint.
operations.description:
Create a new alarm for a study task in the study planner system.

This operation enables authenticated student users to set alarms for their individual study tasks. The alarm includes a user-friendly title and a scheduled timestamp when the PWA notification should trigger.

Security considerations ensure only the owning student can create alarms for their tasks. Validation on the alarm time and uniqueness constraints prevent duplicate alarms.

This API interfaces with the study_planner_task_alarms table, which holds individual alarms referencing the study task and student.

Expected behavior involves storing the alarm record and returning the created alarm details upon success.

If the user is unauthorized or provides invalid data, appropriate errors are returned.

requestBody.description: Information required to create a new study task alarm

responseBody.description: The created study task alarm information

operations.specification: Update an existing study task alarm belonging to an authenticated student user. Allows modification of the alarm title and the scheduled alarm time. The operation ensures ownership verification, valid alarm time, and respects the uniqueness constraint to prevent conflicts with existing alarms. It operates on the study_planner_task_alarms table which stores user-specific alarms linked to study tasks.
operations.description:
Update the properties of an existing study task alarm.

This operation allows a student to modify their previously set alarm's title and trigger time. It validates ownership, ensuring the alarm belongs to the requesting student, and checks for valid input including future alarm times.

The operation guarantees no duplication with other alarms having the same student, study task, and alarm time.

The underlying data resides in the study_planner_task_alarms table with all relevant constraints.

Successful updates return the updated alarm details; errors such as unauthorized access or invalid input return appropriate status codes.

It verifies that the alarm identified by the taskAlarmId belongs to the requesting student. The underlying storage is the study_planner_task_alarms table which includes a soft delete field, but this operation performs a hard delete removing the record entirely from the database. The process ensures integrity by cascading deletions appropriately and confirming authorization before deletion.
operations.description:
Delete an existing study task alarm.

This operation permanently removes a specified alarm associated with a student's study task from the system. Prior authorization checks ensure that only the owner can delete their alarms to maintain data security.

The deletion is definitive; data cannot be recovered once erased.

Data integrity is maintained by cascading or adjusting any dependent data relating to the deleted alarm.

Errors for unauthorized access or missing records are handled with proper error codes.
operations.summary: Delete a study task alarm

parameters.name: taskAlarmId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target task alarm

operations.specification: Retrieve a paginated, filtered list of general reminders for the authenticated student user. These reminders are not tied to specific study tasks but serve as general notifications. The operation interfaces with the study_planner_general_reminders table, supporting search and filtering capabilities by title, due time, and active status. Pagination and sorting options allow clients to receive manageable chunks of reminders. The response includes summary information optimized for list display.
operations.description:
Get a paginated list of general reminders.

This operation returns general reminder records created by the authenticated student. These reminders are independent of study tasks and serve as personal notifications or to-do items.

Filtering by title, reminder status, and due time range is supported to allow users to narrow down results.

Pagination parameters control data volume and sorting by due time or creation date.

Security ensures only the authenticated user's reminders are returned.

Data is fetched from the study_planner_general_reminders table.

Invalid input leads to error responses with validation details.

It is designed to allow authenticated student users to view their own general reminders, which are not tied to specific study tasks but provide scheduled notifications with title, due time, optional descriptions, and active status. The operation ensures that only authenticated users can access their reminders and that the reminder exists and belongs to the user. It returns the full detailed reminder record including all timestamps and active flags.
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a single general reminder based on its UUID identifier. This operation fetches the reminder data from the study_planner_general_reminders table.

Only authenticated users can perform this operation to ensure privacy and security of user-specific reminder data.

The reminder is uniquely identified by the path parameter generalReminderId, which corresponds to the primary key UUID field in the database. The returned data includes the reminder title, scheduled due time, optional description, active status indicating if the reminder is currently effective, and timestamps for creation and updates.

If the specified general reminder does not exist or does not belong to the authenticated user, the operation will result in an appropriate 404 Not Found or authorization error response handled by the service logic.

No request body is needed as the identifier is provided in the URL path, and the response body returns the main IStudyPlannerGeneralReminder entity.

It requires a request body containing the reminder title, due time, optional description, and active status flag. Upon successful creation, the operation returns the full created general reminder entity with all associated metadata including creation and update timestamps. The system enforces that reminders are associated with the authenticated user, and proper validation ensures all required fields are provided and valid.
operations.description:
Create a new general reminder linked to the authenticated student user. The request body must include a title, due time in ISO 8601 format, an optional description, and the active flag status.

The system validates that the user is authenticated before creating the reminder.

After successful creation, the newly created general reminder entity is returned in the response, containing all fields stored including timestamps.

This operation operates on the study_planner_general_reminders table and ensures user ownership and data integrity.

operations.description:
Update an existing general reminder identified by its UUID in the system. The authenticated user can modify the title, due time, optional description, and active status via the request body.

After completion, the reminder data is permanently removed and cannot be recovered.

Returns no content upon successful deletion.

This operation retrieves a paginated and filtered list of study progress analytics data, operating on the study_planner_study_progress_analytics table. It provides metrics such as completed tasks count, total tasks count, and completion rate per student and study phase. The operation supports filtering, sorting, and pagination and restricts access to data belonging strictly to the authenticated student, enforcing privacy and security.

This operation retrieves a filtered and paginated list of study progress analytics records for the authenticated student in the studyPlanner system. It provides detailed progress metrics for study tasks categorized by study phases like preview, main learning, and review.

Only authenticated students can access their own study progress analytics data to ensure user privacy and security.

The operation queries the study_planner_study_progress_analytics Prisma table with support for advanced filtering and pagination parameters passed in the request body.

The response delivers paginated analytics matching search criteria, enabling clients to present summaries and lists.

Errors due to invalid input or unauthorized access are handled with appropriate responses.

Typically used alongside detail retrieval operations for comprehensive analytics management.

authorization.name: student
authorization.description: Authenticated student user who can register, login, manage their learning activities including preview, main learning, review phases, create and update study tasks, set memos and alarms, and view learning progress analytics.

limit.description: Limitation of records per a page.

pages.description:
Total pages.

Equal to {@link records} / {@link limit} with ceiling.

access.description:
JWT access token for authenticated requests.

This token should be included in the Authorization header for subsequent
authenticated API requests as `Bearer {token}`.

refresh.description:
Refresh token for obtaining new access tokens.

This token can be used to request new access tokens when the current access
token expires, extending the user's session.

expired_at.description:
Access token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating when the access token will expire and
can no longer be used for authentication.

refreshable_until.description:
Refresh token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating the latest time until which the
refresh token can be used to obtain new access tokens.

IAuthorizationToken.description:
Authorization token response structure.

This interface defines the structure of the authorization token response
returned after successful user authentication. It contains both access and
refresh tokens along with their expiration information.

This token structure is automatically included in API schemas when the system
detects authorization roles in the requirements analysis phase. It provides a
standard format for JWT-based authentication across the generated backend
applications.

IStudyPlannerStudyPhases.description:
Defines a study phase such as preview, main learning, or review. Each phase categorizes study activities and includes timestamps for record creation and updates.

The 'code' is a unique string used to identify the phase programmatically.

The 'name' is the human-readable name for display purposes.

The optional 'description' provides further details about the phase.

Timestamps track creation and last update times.

Can be null or omitted.

IStudyPlannerStudyTasks.description:
Study task entity representing an individual learning activity owned by a student.

Each task is linked to a student, a study phase, and a subject category. It stores metadata including a unique UUID, title, optional description, creation/update timestamps, and a soft delete timestamp.

This entity supports core task management features by tracking the learning goal and associating it with categorized study phases for progress monitoring.

id.description: Unique identifier of the study task (uuid v4)

student_id.description: The student UUID who owns this task

study_phase_id.description: The study phase UUID e.g. preview, main_learning, review

subject_category_id.description: The subject category UUID representing the study topic

title.description: Title of the study task describing the learning goal

description.description: Optional detailed explanation of the study task

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the record was created

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp; null if not deleted

title.description: Title of the study task capturing the user's learning goal.

description.description: Detailed description or notes about the study task.

id.description:
Primary key UUID identifier for the study task progress record.

Unique identifier for the progress entry linked to a specific study task and study phase.

study_task_id.description:
UUID of the associated study task.

Links progress to a specific study task.

study_phase_id.description:
UUID of the study phase (preview, main learning, review) tracked.

Specifies which study phase this progress record belongs to.

completed_at.description:
Timestamp when the study phase was completed for the task.

Nullable; null means not yet completed.

created_at.description:
Timestamp of record creation.

Indicates when this progress record was initially created.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp of last update.

Indicates the last time this progress record was modified.

IStudyPlannerStudyTaskProgress.description:
Represents progress tracking state for a study task in a specific study phase. This includes completion timestamps and audit information.

Tracks phase completion milestones for tasks to support study lifecycle management and analytics.

IStudyPlannerStudyTaskProgress.IUpdate.description:
Payload to update the completion timestamp of a study task progress entry.

Allows setting or clearing the completed_at timestamp to mark phase completion or incompletion.

Only the completed_at field is updateable.

completed_at.description: Completion timestamp (ISO 8601) or null to mark incomplete

id.description: Primary Key.

title.description: Title of the study task capturing the user's learning goal.

description.description: Detailed description or notes about the study task.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the study task was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the study task was last updated.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp when the study task was soft deleted; null if not deleted.

student_id.description:
UUID of the student creating the study task.

This associates the task with a specific student owner.

study_phase_id.description: UUID of the study phase assigned to this task (preview, main learning, review).

subject_category_id.description: UUID of the subject category linked to the study task.

title.description: Title of the study task, describing its learning objective.

description.description: Optional detailed description or notes about the study task.

IStudyPlannerStudyTask.ICreate.description:
Input payload required to create a new study task. Includes student ownership, study phase, subject category, and task title.

An optional description may be provided.

study_task_id.description:
UUID of the associated study task for which progress is created.

Links the progress record to a specific study task

study_phase_id.description:
UUID of the study phase being tracked in this progress entry.

Specifies the study phase this progress entry represents.

completed_at.description:
Timestamp marking the completion time for the study phase.

Null means phase not completed.

IStudyPlannerStudyTaskProgress.ICreate.description:
Input data required to create a new study task progress record for a specific study phase.

Includes the task and phase identifiers and completion timestamp.

IStudyPlannerAttachment.description:
An attachment file linked to a study task, representing image or PDF content.

This entity stores metadata for the attachment including its file type and URL.

The created_at timestamp records when the attachment was added to the system.

id.description: Unique identifier of the attachment.

study_task_id.description: UUID of the related study task this attachment belongs to.

file_type.description: MIME type of the attachment file, e.g., 'image/jpeg' or 'application/pdf'.

file_url.description: URL or URI to access the attachment file.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the attachment record was created.

IStudyPlannerAttachment.ICreate.description:
Data required to create a new attachment linked to a study task.

Only the study_task_id, file_type, and file_url are provided by the client.

The id and created_at fields are generated by the system.

study_task_id.description: UUID of the study task to associate the attachment with.

file_type.description: MIME type of the attachment file to be created.

file_url.description: URL or URI where the attachment file is stored.

IStudyPlannerAttachment.IUpdate.description:
Data for updating a study task attachment.

Only file_type and file_url can be updated.

Other fields such as id and study_task_id cannot be changed.

file_type.description: Updated MIME type of the attachment file.

file_url.description: Updated URL or URI of the attachment file.

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerMemo.description:
A memo note linked to a study task providing textual information or comments.

Includes memo text and timestamps for creation and update.

id.description: Unique identifier of the memo.

study_task_id.description: UUID of the related study task this memo belongs to.

memo_text.description: Text content of the memo note.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the memo was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the memo was last updated.

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerMemoArray.description:
An array of memos attached to a study task.

Each item represents a memo providing textual notes related to a study task.

memo_text.description:
Text content of the memo providing additional details or notes.

This field holds the textual memo associated with a specific study task.
It supports note-taking for the student study activity management.

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerMemoICreate.description:
Create request body for a study task memo. Contains the memo text.

Note: The study_task_id field is set internally and should not be sent in the request.

memo_text.description:
Text content of the memo providing additional details or notes.

Can be null to clear the memo.

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerMemos.IUpdate.description: Update request body for a study task memo. Supports partial update of memo text.

id.description:
Primary Key.
Unique identifier of the memo.

memo_text.description: Text content of the memo providing additional details or notes.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the memo was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the memo was last updated.

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerMemos.description: Represents a memo attached to a study task containing the memo text and timestamps.

limit.description:
Maximum number of records per page.
Default value is 100 if not specified.

search.description: Optional filter for alarm title supporting partial matching.

study_task_id.description: Optional study task ID filter to retrieve alarms related to specific study tasks.

order_by_created_at.description:
Sort by creation date.
Allowed values: 'asc' or 'desc'.

order_by_alarm_time.description:
Sort by alarm time.
Allowed values: 'asc' or 'desc'.

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerTaskAlarms.IReq.description: Request parameters for searching and paginating task alarms.

id.description: Primary Key UUID for the task alarm record.

student_id.description: UUID of the student who owns this alarm.

study_task_id.description: UUID of the associated study task.

title.description: Title or label of the alarm for identification.

alarm_time.description: Scheduled time for the alarm to trigger the notification in ISO 8601 format.

deleted_at.description: Optional soft deletion timestamp indicating logical removal.

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerTaskAlarms.description:
Study task alarm entity storing alarm details such as title, alarm time, and association with student and study task.

This entity supports scheduling notifications and is managed per authenticated student user.

student_id.description: UUID of the student who owns this alarm.

study_task_id.description: UUID of the associated study task.

title.description: Title or label for the alarm.

alarm_time.description: Scheduled date-time for the alarm notification trigger.

IStudyPlannerTaskAlarm.ICreate.description:
Request body schema for creating a new study task alarm.

Contains required fields to define alarm owner and trigger details, excluding auto-generated fields like id and timestamps.

title.description: Optional updated title of the alarm.

alarm_time.description: Optional updated scheduled date-time for the alarm.

IStudyPlannerTaskAlarm.IUpdate.description:
Request body schema for updating details of an existing study task alarm.

Only title and alarm_time are updatable fields.

id.description: Primary Key UUID for the task alarm record.

student_id.description: UUID of the student who owns this alarm.

study_task_id.description: UUID of the associated study task.

title.description: Title or label for the alarm.

alarm_time.description: Scheduled time for the alarm in ISO 8601 format.

IStudyPlannerTaskAlarm.description:
A study task alarm entity including all details such as id, ownership, title, scheduled trigger time, and timestamps.

Deleted_at is nullable and used for soft deletes.

student_id.description:
Optional filter for the ID of the student to restrict reminders.

@format uuid

title.description:
Optional filter for reminder title matching.

This enables search by reminder title.

due_time_from.description:
Optional minimum due time filter; reminders due after this time.

@format date-time

due_time_to.description:
Optional maximum due time filter; reminders due before this time.

@format date-time

page.description:
Pagination: page number starting from 1.

Optional; defaults to null if not specified.

limit.description:
Pagination: maximum number of records per page.

Optional; defaults to null if not specified.

IStudyPlannerGeneralReminder.IRequest.description: Request schema for filtering and paginated retrieval of general reminders.

id.description:
Unique ID of the general reminder.

@format uuid

student_id.description:
ID of the student who owns this reminder.

@format uuid

title.description:
Friendly name or title of the general reminder for identification.

This is a brief label shown to the user to describe the reminder.
It is required to be non-empty.

due_time.description:
Scheduled due time of the reminder as an ISO 8601 datetime string.

This indicates when the notification should be triggered.
Must be a valid date-time string.

Example: "2023-12-31T10:00:00Z"

description.description:
Optional detailed description providing extra context for the reminder.

This field can be null or a string.

active.description:
Whether this reminder is active and will trigger notifications.

This boolean controls if the reminder is currently enabled.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp of last update to the reminder.

@format date-time

IStudyPlannerGeneralReminder.description:
Entity representing a general reminder set by a student to receive notifications.

It includes scheduling, descriptive text, active state, and audit timestamps.

title.description:
Friendly name or title of the new general reminder.

This is required and serves as the label for the reminder.

due_time.description:
Scheduled due time for this reminder.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string.

description.description:
Optional description explaining the reminder in more detail.

This field may be null.

active.description: Flag indicating whether the reminder is active and should trigger notifications.

IStudyPlannerGeneralReminder.ICreate.description:
Schema for creating a new general reminder.

Includes title, due time, optional description, and active flag.

title.description:
Optional updated title of the reminder.

If included, overrides the existing title.

due_time.description:
Optional updated due time.

ISO 8601 date-time format if provided.

description.description:
Optional updated description.

Nullable field to allow clearing or changing description.

IStudyPlannerGeneralReminder.IUpdate.description:
Schema for updating an existing general reminder.

All fields are optional and may be null.

student_id.description: Filter by student unique identifier. Use null to ignore this filter.

study_phase_id.description: Filter by study phase unique identifier. Use null to ignore this filter.

sortBy.description: Sort records by created or updated timestamp.

IStudyPlannerStudyProgressAnalytics.IReq.description: Request object for searching and filtering study progress analytics.

id.description: Unique identifier of the study progress analytics record.

study_phase_id.description: Unique identifier of the study phase.

completed_tasks_count.description: Number of completed tasks for the student in the given study phase.

total_tasks_count.description: Total number of tasks assigned to the student in the study phase.

completion_rate.description: Completion rate computed as completed tasks divided by total tasks.

IStudyPlannerStudyProgressAnalytics.description:
Aggregated study progress analytics per student and study phase.

This entity provides metrics such as completed tasks count, total tasks count, and completion rate.

It relates to students and study phases for tracking learning progress across phases.

student_id.description: Filter by student unique identifier. Use null to ignore this filter.

subject_category_id.description: Filter by subject category unique identifier. Use null to ignore this filter.

sortBy.description: Sort records by created or updated timestamp.

IStudyPlannerLearningGapCharts.IRequest.description: Request object for searching and filtering learning gap charts.

id.description: Unique identifier of the learning gap chart record.

subject_category_id.description: Unique identifier of the subject category.

gap_metric.description: Quantified measure of the learning gap for the subject category.

IStudyPlannerLearningGapCharts.description:
Analytics data showing learning gap statistics per student and subject category.

This entity highlights underperformed areas in study tasks, linked to students and subject categories to assist targeted improvements and visualization.

id.description: Unique identifier of the student user

email.description: Email address of the student user used for login

IStudyPlannerStudent.ISummary.description: Summary information of student user containing essential identification fields only.

id.description: Unique identifier of the study phase

code.description: Unique code identifier of the study phase

name.description: Human-readable name of the study phase

IStudyPlannerStudyPhases.ISummary.description: Summary information of study phase including id, code, and name.

id.description: Unique identifier of the subject category

code.description: Unique code identifier of the subject category

name.description: Human-readable name of the subject category

IStudyPlannerSubjectCategories.ISummary.description: Summary information of subject category including id, code, and name.

id.description: Unique identifier of the study task

study_phase_id.description: Unique identifier of the associated study phase

subject_category_id.description: Unique identifier of the associated subject category

IStudyPlannerStudyTasks.ISummary.description: Summary information for study tasks, including identifiers and title.

id.description: Primary key identifier of the attachment

file_type.description: Type of the attachment file, e.g., image/jpeg, application/pdf

file_url.description: URI of the stored attachment file for retrieval

IStudyPlannerAttachment.ISummary.description:
Summary information of an attachment file linked to a study task.

This summary includes the unique ID, file type, and the file URL for access.

id.description: Primary key identifier of the task alarm

title.description: Title or label of the alarm for user identification

alarm_time.description: Scheduled time for the alarm to trigger the notification

study_task_id.description: Referenced study task's identifier for which the alarm is set

IStudyPlannerStudyPlannerTaskAlarms.ISum.description:
Summary information of a task alarm set by a student for a study task.

Includes unique ID, alarm title, alarm time, and linked study task identifier.

id.description: Primary key identifier of the general reminder

title.description: Title or label of the general reminder for user identification

due_time.description: Scheduled due time for the general reminder notification

active.description: Boolean flag indicating the reminder's active status

description.description: Optional textual description providing additional context for the reminder

created_at.description: Timestamp of record creation for audit and history

updated_at.description: Timestamp of last update for audit and history

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp indicating logical removal (nullable)

IStudyPlannerGeneralReminder.ISummary.description:
Summary information of a general reminder created by a student.

Includes unique ID, title, due time, and active status.

Note: detailed properties like description, created_at, updated_at, deleted_at, and student_id are normally excluded from summaries.
